definition: to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: Just one last dance before we say goodbye.
Parting with you, want to say far more than kilowatts.
sentences.chinese: 与你们离别时，想说的话何止万千。

sentences.english: And if you just as first, don't be sad and leave.
sentences.chinese: 若与你只如初见，又何须伤感离别。

sentences.english: At last, they met again, at a airport.
sentences.chinese: 终于重遇，在那制造无数离别和重逢的机场。

sentences.english: Neither shall there be sorrow or dying, neither shall there be any more pain, for.
sentences.chinese: 不再有悲伤和生死离别，不再有痛苦，因往事已矣。

sentences.english: My friend gave me his picture as a keepsake before going away.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友在离别前给我一张照片留作纪念。

sentences.english: Just, the sorrow of parting was camouflaged by the dark night at that moment.
sentences.chinese: 只是，那时夜晚的黑幕遮蔽了离别的哀愁。

sentences.english: If I should meet thee, After long years, How should I greet thee?
sentences.chinese: 多年离别后，抑或再相逢，相逢何所语？

sentences.english: Her voice did quiver as we parted.
sentences.chinese: 离别时，她的嗓音颤微微。

sentences.english: Leave home, people lack of Yiming.
The world's most tragic thing apart from dying, and no more.
sentences.chinese: 世上最悲凉旳事除了生死离别，还有物是人非。

sentences.chinese: 离别短缺经济后，技术创新对企业的发展至关重要。

sentences.chinese: 罗逸菲赶紧让钟离别在说了。

sentences.chinese: 伤离别，离别虽然在眼前。

definition: to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
separated in life and death/to part for ever
to think of/to long for/to miss
see 天下沒有不散的筵席|天下没有不散的筵席[tian1 xia4 mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan2 xi2]
pinyin: tian1 xia4 mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan4 xi2

definition: to see each other/to meet in person
